abstract: On Aug. 15, 1965, the Beatles took the stage at Shea Stadium to a crowd of 55,000 screaming fans. Today marks 50 years since Beatlemania set attendance records and defined the power of the outdoor summer concert. Take a look at the madness that day ...
body: On Aug. 15, 1965, the Beatles took the stage at Shea Stadium to a crowd of 55,000 screaming fans. Today marks 50 years since Beatlemania set attendance records and defined the power of the outdoor summer concert. Take a look at the madness that day ...
mobileTitle: The Beatles rock Shea Stadium in 1965
title: The Beatles rock Shea Stadium in 1965

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: On Aug. 15, 1965, the Beatles took the stage at Shea Stadium to a crowd of 55,000 screaming fans. It's been 50 years since Beatlemania set attendance records and defined the power of the outdoor summer concert. Take a look back at the madness that day ...

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: One of the biggest stories out of Shea Stadium that night was the hysteria of the audience. Among the delirious teenagers at the sold-out concert was this fan, who had to be carried off after fainting on Aug. 15, 1965.

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: Tickets for the Aug. 15, 1965 Beatles concert sold for a mere $5.10. This concert paved the way for musical acts from Bruce Springsteen to Stevie Wonder to also perform at the Flushing ballpark.
images.credit: Walter Daran for New York Daily News

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: One concert goer rocked a little too hard and got carried out by the police on Aug. 15, 1965. The crazy concert was filmed and later turned into a fifty-minute documentary produced by the great Ed Sullivan and first aired on March 1, 1966 on BBC1.

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: Backstage at the 1965 concert, Ringo Starr is seen putting the finishing touches on his outfit before greeting the massive crowd. The famous concert was filmed and later aired in the United States on ABC on Jan. 10, 1967.

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: Legendary concert promoter Sid Bernstein is best known for bringing the Beatles to America for their first concert at Shea Stadium. The set they played that night included hits "Ticket to Ride," "Can't Buy Me Love" and "A Hard Day's Night" to name a few.

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: One fan lets loose for Beatlemania outside Hotel Warwick in 1965. The scene at the hotel was nearly as frantic as the one inside Shea Stadium that night.

This photo shows the actual ticket from the show on Aug. 15, 1965. The ticket is preserved and on display at the New York Triple Pier Antique Show along with other historical rock memorabilia that was eventually auctioned off online.
images.imagetitle: Ticket from the 1965 concert at Shea Stadium

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: A fan admires a Beatles album as she waits for the Beatles to start their very first show at Shea Stadium in 1965. The concert was marked a milestone in popular music history as it was the first to be held at a major stadium.

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: The 55,000 person crowd consisted of fans of all ages packing the stadium to the brim on Aug. 15, 1965.

images.alt: Beatles at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965.
images.caption: The Beatles' 1965 concert at Shea Stadium was the very first of its kind and the first major music event at the baseball stadium. The success of the event led to the Beatles returning in August 1966 for a second show. It got just as wild ...

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 23, 1966.
images.caption: The crowd went wild -- sometimes, a little too wild -- at the outdoor concert on Aug. 23, 1966. This was the second time the Beatles played at Shea Stadium.

The Beatles take the stage! The iconic rock band is pictured here among thousands of screaming fans at their historic concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 15, 1965. Nearly 50 years later, member Paul McCartney played the last concert at Shea Stadium with fellow rocker Billy Joel before the stadium finally closed.

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 23, 1966.
images.caption: In fact, it took a Wells Fargo armored car to transport the Beatles into Shea Stadium for their second concert in August 1965. The iconic rockers started off their journey to Queens in a car with style ...

images.alt: Beatles concert at Shea Stadium on Aug. 23, 1966.
images.caption: The Beatles cruised the Big Apple in style. The iconic rock band is seen here leaving Hotel Warwick in a spiffy limousine to head to Shea Stadium in 1966.
